subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to unit test Eclipse Plugin and RCP?
msgSnippet: Codign Software offers a solution to unit testing plug-ins in Eclipse 3.2. Our product, CoView, is new to the market, creates JUnit tests and measures both
messageBody:
Codign Software offers a solution to unit testing
plug-ins in Eclipse 3.2. Our product, CoView, is new
to the market, creates JUnit tests and measures both
path and branch coverage. You can find out more
information at www.codign.com.

We offer a commercial product that was just released
and is available for a 30-day trial.

We are looking for some early adopters and in exchange
for your time and insight, we can offer some flexible
pricing options.

You can contact me at joe.ponczak at codign.com if you
want some more information.



--- David Saff <saff@...> wrote:

> Sudhan,
>
> Does DevTest automatically create tests that operate
> in the Eclipse
> runtime? I couldn't find specific references to
> functionality like that
> from the webpage.
>
> David Saff
>
> sudhan.moghe wrote:
> > Hi
> >
> > You can use AppPerfect DevTest for testing eclipse
> plugin. Integrate
> > DevTest in your development Eclipse and use
> UnitTester for testing
> > plugins.
> > The product will automatically generate testcases
> for each method in
> > your plugin. Product also has nice UI for
> adding/editing testcases.
> >
> > Regards,
> > Sudhan
> >
> > --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "isaachanstar"
> <isaachanstar@...> wrote:
> >
> >> hi, all
> >>
> >> Could anyone make some suggestions of how to unit
> test Eclipse Plugin,
> >> especially RCP application? There are any
> strategies, tips, or tools
> >> in your brains and toolboxes?
> >>
> >> Thanks!
> >>
> >>
